H0.text: Control is the activity for which a ship’s satellite communication device, used to identify the ship’s position at sea, is most likely used.

H1.text: Guidance is the activity for which a ship’s satellite communication device, used to identify the ship’s position at sea, is most likely employed.

H2.text: Propulsion is the activity for which a ship uses a satellite communication device to identify its position at sea.

H3.text: Suspension is the activity for which a ship's satellite communication device—used to identify the ship's position at sea—is most likely employed.

A4.text: Fleet tracking: used to identify, locate and maintain contact reports with one or more fleet vehicles in real-time.

A5.text: Navigation: navigators value digitally precise velocity and orientation measurements, as well as precise positions in real-time with a support of orbit and clock corrections.

A6.text: Navigation and location of the ship by positioning techniques based on the aids provided by global positioning systems, such as GPS, GLONASS, or GALILEO.
